Hi! Has anyone ever tried to translate the Beliefs mechanic from The Burning Wheel to Dungeon World? Something like Bonds or Flags? I know it wouldn&#39;t be as deep, but I&#39;d really like to create something in that spirit, the thing is that I don&#39;t have the experience with BW to do it justice...
<div id='comment z121xtqjdumpyvsou04ccnwacwv5z1krpw00k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103135862354725331808_photo.jpg'> Ben McKee</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-02-27 17:20:48 (edited: 2017-02-27 17:20:48)</cite></p>
        <p>.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z121xtqjdumpyvsou04ccnwacwv5z1krpw00k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/106886822779598545662_photo.jpg'> Arthur Lahey</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-02-27 17:59:45 (edited: 2017-02-27 17:59:45)</cite></p>
        <p>Stumbled upon this a while back, although admittedly I haven&#39;t played it as of yet:<br /><a href="http://story-games.com/forums/discussion/20373/dungeon-wheel-a-grittier-dw-hack-using-bw-tech" data-embed="-hFdaHR0cDovL3N0b3J5LWdhbWVzLmNvbS9mb3J1bXMvZGlzY3Vzc2lvbi8yMDM3My9kdW5nZW9uLXdoZWVsLWEtZ3JpdHRpZXItZHctaGFjay11c2luZy1idy10ZWNo" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">http://story-games.com/forums/discussion/20373/dungeon-wheel-a-grittier-dw-hack-using-bw-tech</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z121xtqjdumpyvsou04ccnwacwv5z1krpw00k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103667855585775066713_photo.jpg'> Aaron Griffin</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-02-27 18:30:20 (edited: 2017-02-27 18:30:48)</cite></p>
        <p>I ran a DW game replacing Alignments and Bonds with 3 beliefs from each player. I actually called them Goals and had the player include WHY a goal was important in the writing (this cleaves close to one specific style of BW Beliefs).<br /><br />Goal: I want to kill the Southwatch Goblin Hoard because they kidnapped my sister and sold her to slavers.<br /><br />Then I updated the End of Session move to include these (1xp for moving towards the goal, 3xp for achieving it). I think I updated the questions too, to include some sort of party-level Goal as well.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z121xtqjdumpyvsou04ccnwacwv5z1krpw00k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/114378929254296219018_photo.jpg'> Guido Ferraro</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-02-27 18:43:19 (edited: 2017-02-27 18:43:19)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/106886822779598545662" oid="106886822779598545662">Arthur Lahey</a></span> the link to the pdf seems to be down. I googled it but had no luck. Do you happen to have it?<br /><br /><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/103667855585775066713" oid="103667855585775066713">Aaron Griffin</a></span> that&#39;s what I&#39;m talking about! Do you still have it?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z121xtqjdumpyvsou04ccnwacwv5z1krpw00k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103667855585775066713_photo.jpg'> Aaron Griffin</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-02-27 18:57:47 (edited: 2017-02-27 18:57:47)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/114378929254296219018" oid="114378929254296219018">Guido Ferraro</a></span> That&#39;s it. I didn&#39;t write up a PDF or anything, it was just a rule change for a specific game. You don&#39;t need anything else. &quot;Write down up to three goals, including why they&#39;re important. At the end of session, every goal you achieved gets you 3xp, and any other you worked towards gets you 1xp. These replace Alignments and Bonds.&quot;</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z121xtqjdumpyvsou04ccnwacwv5z1krpw00k'>

Let me know if the link doesn&#39;t work.<br /><a href="https://drive.google.com/open?id=0BwCP580_kpMRRzlhVGhWX3VIdzQ" data-embed="_" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">https://drive.google.com/open?id=0BwCP580_kpMRRzlhVGhWX3VIdzQ</a></p>
